    Xianwen Jing

    Associate Professor

    • Huangshi, China
    • Hubei Normal University

    CV

    Education

    • Ph.D in Meteorology, Graduate University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, 2012
    • M.S. in Meteorology, Nanjing University of information Science & Technology, 2009
    • B.S. in Applied Meteorology, Nanjing University of information Science & Technology, 2006

    Work experience

    • October 2021 – current: Associate Professor
      • College of Urban and Environmental Sciences, Hubei Normal University
      • Address: No.11 Cihu Road, Huangshi, Hubei 435002, China
    • Septemper 2019 – December 2020: Postdoctoral Research Fellow
      • Department of Climate and Space Sciences and Engineering, University of Michigan
      • Address: 2455 Hayward Street, Ann Arbor, MI 48109-2143, USA
    • June 2016 – May 2019: Postdoctoral Research Fellow
      • Atmosphere and Ocean Research Institute, University of Tokyo
      • Address: 5-1-5 Kashiwanoha, Kashiwa, Chiba 277-8568, Japan
    • July 2012 – May 2016: Senior Engineer
      • National Climate Center, Chinese Administration of Meteorology
      • Address: No.46 Zhongguancun Nandajie, Haidian, Beijing 100081, China

    Publications

    • Implications of Spaceborne High-resolution Solar Spectral Irradiance Observation for the Assessment of Surface Solar Energy in China

      Kong, Chenxi, Xianwen Jing, Xiaorui Niu, and Jing Jing. 2025. "Implications of Spaceborne High-resolution Solar Spectral Irradiance Observation for the Assessment of Surface Solar Energy in China" Preprints 2025020414. https://doi.org/10.20944/preprints202502.0414.v1

    • Domain adaptation method for extracting buildings from remote sensing images using dual contrastive learning

      He, Chunxiu, Xianwen Jing. 2024. "Domain adaptation method for extracting buildings from remote sensing images using dual contrastive learning". J. Appl. Rem. Sens. 18(3), 034517. https://doi.org/10.1117/1.JRS.18.034517

    • Impact of a New Radiation Scheme on Simulated Climate in the Global–Regional Integrated SysTem Model under Varying Physical Parameterization Schemes

      Yuan, Chang, Hua Zhang, Xianwen Jing, Shuyun Zhao, and Xiaohan Li. 2024. "Impact of a New Radiation Scheme on Simulated Climate in the Global–Regional Integrated SysTem Model under Varying Physical Parameterization Schemes". Atmosphere 15, no. 4: 501. https://doi.org/10.3390/atmos15040501

    • Direct Influence of Solar Spectral Irradiance on the High-Latitude Surface Climate

      Jing, Xianwen, Xianglei Huang, Xiuhong Chen, Dong L. Wu, Peter Pilewskie, Odele Coddington, and Erik Richard. 2021. "Direct Influence of Solar Spectral Irradiance on the High-Latitude Surface Climate", Journal of Climate 34, 10 (2021): 4145-4158. https://doi.org/10.1175/JCLI-D-20-0743.1

    • The Key Role of Warm Rain Parameterization in Determining the Aerosol Indirect Effect in a Global Climate Model

      Jing, Xianwen, Kentaroh Suzuki, and Takuro Michibata. 2019. "The key role of warm rain parameterization in determining the aerosol indirect effect in a global climate model". Journal of Climate 32, 14: 4409-4430. https://doi.org/10.1175/JCLI-D-18-0789.1

    • The Impact of Process-Based Warm Rain Constraints on the Aerosol Indirect Effect

      Jing, Xianwen, Kentaroh Suzuki. 2018. "The impact of process-based warm rain constraints on the aerosol indirect effect". Geophysical Research Letters 45, 10,729–10,737. https://doi.org/10.1029/2018GL079956

    • Improving Representation of Tropical Cloud Overlap in GCMs Based on Cloud-Resolving Model Data

      Jing, Xianwen, Hua Zhang, Masaki Satoh, and Shuyun Zhao. 2018. "Improving Representation of Tropical Cloud Overlap in GCMs Based on Cloud-Resolving Model Data". Journal of Meteorological Research 32, 233–245. https://doi.org/10.1007/s13351-018-7095-9

    • A Multimodel Study on Warm Precipitation Biases in Global Models Compared to Satellite Observations

      Jing, Xianwen, Kentaroh Suzuki, Huan Guo, Daisuke Goto, Tomoo Ogura, Tsuyoshi Koshiro, Johannes Mülmenstädt. 2017. "A multimodel study on warm precipitation biases in global models compared to satellite observations". Journal of Geophysical Research: Atmospheres 122, 11,806–11,824. https://doi.org/10.1002/2017JD027310

    • Advances in studies of cloud overlap and its radiative transfer in climate models

      Zhang, Hua, Xianwen Jing. 2016. "Advances in Studies on Cloud Overlap and Its Radiative Transfer in Climate Models". Journal of Meteorological Research 30, 156-168. https://doi.org/10.1007/s13351-016-5164-5

    • Cloud overlapping parameter obtained from CloudSat/CALIPSO dataset and its application in AGCM with McICA scheme

      Jing, Xianwen, Hua Zhang, Jie Peng, Jiangnan Li, Howard W. Barker. 2016. "Cloud overlapping parameter obtained from CloudSat/CALIPSO dataset and its application in AGCM with McICA scheme". Atmospheric Research 170, 52-65. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.atmosres.2015.11.007
